This Pull is to help understand the improvement at JIRA - https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/WICKET-5926

I'm using JDK 8 here.
So if you are using JDK 7, you need to modify the file arquillian.xml. At the property javaVmArguments, switch the parameter:
-XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=128m
with
-XX:MaxPermSize=128m

Using Arquillian with Java EE 6 (CDI+EJB+JPA) and Wicket and the applied the patch suggested. Was so fast and the configuration is less than before with Spring.

![screenshot from 2015-06-22 21 11 49](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6169365/8296161/83010f94-1923-11e5-9f57-1d1778e300cc.png)

Martin,
Thank you for your patience and help!
My projects and those tests are also using the project https://github.com/ingwarsw/arquillian-suite-extension. I had to search a while because before using this project, Arquillian , I think that's by default, deploys micro deployments.
It's kind of easy to use. To summarize, it take all tests and do just one single deployment, so the deployment time is less than doing micro deployments as Arquillian does. Arquillian in future could use this idea, it's worthwhile. It's working great and a project with lots of tests and big tests runs fast!

The first commit is rather big so it is hard to find out - so my question: Is there any documentation about how to setup the php environment to convert gdoc to adoc, or is it simply copy the php files into the root folder of the php server? Thanks for the great work so far! :smiley:
Thanks!
This is an API break and will have to wait Wicket 8.x.
Of course because of semantic versioning i think
Please, do not mix formatting and refactoring.

Please start a discussion at Wicket's dev@ (or users@) mailing list with explanation of your use cases.
IMO only the method in Localizer could be improved. Removing `final` from the other two could break Wicket internals really bad if the application developer is not really careful.

The php scripts can be thrown away after the merge of this commits because then the documentation should be updated in the .adoc files and not in the .gdoc files anymore. 

To start converting all the gdoc files to adoc you need to pass all the gdoc files through the `adoccommandline.php`. `run.sh` is doing that, it's searching all the gdoc files in guide/ and convert it to adoc format in asciidoc/. So the first step is run `$ ./run.sh`. 

The next step is that there should be one index.adoc file which include all the other adoc files. Gdoc has toc.yml but asciidoc need a completely other syntax. `toctoindex.php` loads guide/toc.yml and give an output that should be index.adoc. To do that, run `$ ./toctoindex.php > asciidoc/index.adoc`.

If that's done, run `$ mvn` in `wicket-user-guide` to render index.adoc to index.html and index.pdf with all adoc files included. In `wicket-user-guide/target/generated-docs` is the result. Ignore the empty directories.

I hope this will help. Thanks for your comment!

Hi Martin,

renderAll was overwritten by us to add some performance profiling, something like this:
<startPerfProfiling>
super.renderAll()
<stopPerfProfiling>

addStateChange() was overwritten to prevent the increment of a page version number, since we manipulated the component hierarchy after rendering, but before the page gets stored. This is a very deep manipulation of Wicket, we are fully aware of that, but it was essential for our high traffic scenario.

Please discuss at dev@ mailing list.
Very few people actually read here.

Another option would be to create a new inteface like this: --- 
package org.apache.wicket;
import org.apache.wicket.model.IModel;
/**
 * An interface for all {@link Component components} with type-safe accessors and mutators
 * for the model and its object.
 *
 * @param 
 *     the type of the model object
 */
public interface IGenericModel
{
    /**
     * Typesafe getter for the model
     *
     * @return the model
     */
    IModel getModel();
    /**
     * Typesafe setter for the model
     *
     * @param model
     *            the new model
     * @return This for chaining
     */
    Component setModel(IModel model);
    /**
     * Typesafe setter for the model object
     *
     * @param object
     *            the new model object
     * @return This for chaining
     */
    Component setModelObject(T object);
    /**
     * Typesafe getter for the model's object
     *
     * @return the model object
     */
    T getModelObject();
}
--- The IGenericComponent is for use for generic Model so the new name IGenericModel would fit better i think

I'm afraid this change could not be applied.
It is an API break and we could not merge it in 7.x branch (currently master).

The methods are `static` so they are not overrideable, so I think there is no big issue here.

Thanks for the PR anyway!
